metadata.titleEn: Dataset of measured aboveground plant biomass and remote sensing net primary productivity in desert sites on theTibet Plateau (2000-2020)
metadata.titleCn: 青藏高原荒漠样点实测植物地上生物量和遥感净初级生产力数据集（2000-2020）
metadata.description: A total of 52 sample sites were selected in the desert belts of Qinghai and Tibet for field sampling of aboveground biomass of vegetation during the vegetation growing season in 2019 and 2020. At the same time, the longitude, latitude and altitude of the experimental site were recorded using handheld GPS devices. The field setting method of the quadrate is as follows: select a section with uniform vegetation. When the vegetation is relatively abundant, the quadrate is set as a 10 m x10 m square plot, and when the vegetation is relatively sparse, the quadrate is set as a 30 m x30 m square plot or a 30 m x90 m rectangular plot. 3-5 small sample boxes (1m x 1m) were randomly thrown into the set sample plot to determine the specific location of the sample. Collect plant samples by sample harvesting method: register plant species, number of plants of each species and other information in sample area of 1 square meter. All kinds of plants in the quadrate were planted and mowed on the ground, and the collected herbaceous plant samples were placed in archives and marked with species, sample site name and number, collection time and other information. They were brought back to the laboratory and dried to a constant weight in a constant temperature drying oven at 65 ℃. The dry weight of the plant samples was measured. Finally, the aboveground biomass of the vegetation was calculated. In addition, two kinds of remote sensing net primary productivity (NPP) data of the 52 sample points were extracted by the longitude and latitude of the sampling points. (1) Enhanced Vegetation Index (EVI) from 2000 to 2018, and calculated the annual Integrated Enhanced Vegetation Index (IEVI). IEVI was highly correlated with net primary productivity (NPP). Can be used as a proxy indicator of net primary productivity (He et al. 2021, Science of The Total Environment). (2) Percentage of remote sensing net primary productivity (NPP) and its quality control (QC) in 2001-2020, NPP remote sensing data from MOD17A3HGF Version 6 product (https://lpdaac.usgs.gov/products/mod17a3hgfv006/), the net photosynthetic value (the total primary productivity - keep breathing) is calculated. In the sample sites with low vegetation coverage, there may be null value (NA) of remote sensing net primary productivity.
metadata.descriptionCn: 在青海和西藏的荒漠带实地调查了52个样点，于2019年和2020年7-8月植被生长最大时期对植被地上生物量进行实地采样。同时，利用手持 GPS设备，记录了实验位点的经度、纬度和海拔等信息。样方的野外设置方法为：选取一块植被均匀的地段，当植被相对茂盛时样地设置为10米x10米的正方形样地，当植被相对稀疏时样地设置为30米x30米的正方形样地或者30米x90米的长方形样地；在设置好的样地中随机投掷3-5个小样方框（1米x1米），采用样方收割法收集植物样品：在1平方米的样方面积内，登记植物的物种名目，每个物种的株数等信息。并将样方内的各种植物分种齐地面刈割，带回实验室内, 在恒温干燥箱内65℃条件下烘干至恒重, 测定植物样本的干重，计算样方地上生物量。 此外，还通过采样点的经度纬度提取了该52个样点的2种遥感净初级生产力数据。(1) 2000-2018年的增强型植被指数(EVI)，并计算年整合增强型植被指数(iEVI)，iEVI与净初级生产力(NPP)具有高相关性，可作为净初级生产力的替代指标(He et al. 2021, Science of The Total Environment)。(2) 2001-2020年遥感净初级生产力(NPP)及其质量控制百分比(QC)，遥感NPP数据来自MOD17A3HGF Version 6 product (https://lpdaac.usgs.gov/products/mod17a3hgfv006/)，由净光合值（总初级生产力-植物维持呼吸）计算得到。植被覆盖度低的样点，遥感净初级生产力可能存在空值(NA)。

background: Global warming has intensified and accelerated the hydrologic cycle, causing precipitation patterns shifting to higher variability and more frequent dry and wet years, which is almost ubiquitous globally. Increasing precipitation variability may profoundly affect ecosystem functioning and structure, especially primary productivity. Therefore, understanding the relationship between plant productivity and precipitation is crucial to ecosystem function and also to humans who depend upon primary productivity for food, fiber and fuel. The lags in the response of ecosystems to changes in precipitation and "asymmetries" in the productivity-precipitation relationship modulate the effect of precipitation variability on productivity. The legacy effect of unusually dry or wet periods on biomass could last for less than one year up to seven years, of which one year is the most commonly reported lag time. Previous-year precipitation has been found to drive the current-year ecosystem process through lagged/legacy effect in multiple sites. At the interannual scale, the lagged precipitation effect is defined as the impact of previous-year precipitation conditions on the current structure and functioning of ecosystems. Drylands comprise 45% of the terrestrial earth surface, and precipitation is the most limiting factor to the functioning of dryland ecosystems. Drylands are inherently slow in the dynamics of soil nutrient buildup and plant productivity compared to other ecosystems, we would expect strong lagged effects of past climate conditions such as precipitation on current functioning. However, our ability to forecast ecosystem responses to climate change is still hindered by our understanding of the mechanisms underlying the lagged precipitation effect.
research objective: In these perspectives, we hypothesize that compared with the unlagged ecosystems, the lagged ones are characterized by (i) lower sensitivity of productivity response to precipitation, (ii) higher interannual precipitation variability and more occurrences of dry and wet years, and (iii) higher sensitivity of other environmental factors to precipitation. To test our hypotheses, we divide terrestrial ecosystems of the Northern Hemisphere drylands into the lagged and unlagged types.
challenges: However, it is still unclear how other environmental factors affect the lagged response of ecosystems to changes in precipitation. Most studies focused on the biotic mechanisms; however, it remains largely uncertain how climatic and edaphic factors may interact with lagged precipitation effects. However, our ability to forecast ecosystem responses to climate change is still hindered by our understanding of the mechanisms underlying the lagged precipitation effect. However, we do not know whether the lagged precipitation effect is associated with precipitation variability.
methods: We used the enhanced vegetation index (EVI) to estimate primary productivity. The MOD13C2 version 6 EVI dataset at 0.05° spatial resolution and monthly compositing periods for the period from February 2000 to December 2018 was employed. For each pixel in the Northern Hemisphere drylands, linear regression and multiple linear models between current-year iEVI and current-year precipitation and/or previous-year precipitation were fitted. To test the first hypothesis, i.e., the lagged type had a lower sensitivity of productivity response to precipitation. We fitted the regressions between iEVI and precipitation for each pixel. To test the second hypothesis, i.e., the lagged type had higher interannual precipitation variability and more occurrences of dry and wet years. We calculated the coefficient of variation (CV) of annual precipitation and the occurrences of dry and wet years for each pixel based on 19-year annual precipitation data. To test the third hypothesis, i.e., the lagged type had a higher sensitivity of other environmental factors to precipitation. We compared the difference between the two types in terms of climatic-edaphic factors, to explore what factors were responsible for the lagged precipitation effect.
dataset: The Tropical Rainfall Measuring Mission (TRMM) product (TRMM 3B42) at 0.25° spatial and daily temporal resolution for the period of 1999-2018 were used. We used the enhanced vegetation index (EVI) to estimate primary productivity. The MOD13C2 version 6 EVI dataset at 0.05° spatial resolution and monthly compositing periods for the period from February 2000 to December 2018 was employed.
findings: Our results show that productivity is less sensitive to precipitation in lagged type than unlagged type along the MAP gradients. Our results support this viewpoint that the lagged precipitation effect plays a vital role in modifying the productivity-precipitation relationship.
backgroundCn: 全球变暖加剧并加速了水文循环，导致降水模式的变化，变得更加多变，干旱年和湿润年更为频繁，这在全球范围内几乎是普遍存在的。降水变异性的增加可能会深刻影响生态系统的功能和结构，尤其是初级生产力。因此，理解植物生产力与降水之间的关系对于生态系统功能以及依赖初级生产力获取食物、纤维和燃料的人类来说至关重要。生态系统对降水变化的响应滞后以及生产力-降水关系中的“非对称性”调节了降水变异性对生产力的影响。异常干旱或湿润时期对生物量的遗留效应可能持续从不到一年到七年，其中一年是最常报告的滞后时间。研究发现，前一年降水量驱动当前年的生态系统过程，通过滞后/遗留效应在多个地点得到了验证。在年际尺度上，滞后降水效应被定义为前一年降水条件对当前生态系统结构和功能的影响。干旱地区占陆地表面的45%，降水是限制干旱生态系统功能的最重要因素。与其他生态系统相比，干旱地区在土壤养分积累和植物生产力的动态变化上本质上较慢，因此我们可以预期过去气候条件（如降水）对当前功能的强烈滞后效应。然而，我们对气候变化下生态系统响应的预测能力仍然受到对滞后降水效应背后机制理解的限制。
research objectiveCn: 在这些视角中，我们假设与未滞后生态系统相比，滞后生态系统的特点是：(i) 生产力对降水的响应敏感性较低，(ii) 年际降水变异性较高，干旱年和湿润年发生的频率更多，以及 (iii) 其他环境因素对降水的敏感性较高。为了验证我们的假设，我们将北半球干旱地区的陆地生态系统分为滞后型和未滞后型。
challengesCn: 然而，目前仍不清楚其他环境因素如何影响生态系统对降水变化的滞后响应。大多数研究集中在生物机制上；然而，气候和土壤因素如何与滞后降水效应相互作用仍然很不确定。然而，我们预测生态系统对气候变化响应的能力仍然受到对滞后降水效应背后机制理解的限制。然而，我们不知道滞后降水效应是否与降水变异性相关。
methodsCn: 我们使用增强植被指数（EVI）来估计初级生产力。采用MOD13C2版本6的EVI数据集，空间分辨率为0.05°，时间范围为2000年2月至2018年12月的每月合成期。对于北半球干旱区的每个像素，我们拟合了当前年份iEVI与当前年份降水量和/或前一年降水量之间的线性回归和多元线性模型。为了检验第一个假设，即滞后类型对降水的生产力响应敏感性较低，我们拟合了每个像素的iEVI与降水量之间的回归关系。为了检验第二个假设，即滞后类型具有更高的年际降水变异性和更多的干湿年发生次数，我们基于19年的年降水数据计算了每个像素的年降水量变异系数（CV）以及干湿年发生次数。为了检验第三个假设，即滞后类型对其他环境因素的敏感性更高，我们比较了两种类型在气候-土壤因素方面的差异，以探讨哪些因素导致了滞后降水效应。
datasetCn: 热带降水测量任务（TRMM）产品（TRMM 3B42）在1999年至2018年期间以0.25°的空间分辨率和每日的时间分辨率被使用。我们使用增强植被指数（EVI）来估算初级生产力。MOD13C2版本6的EVI数据集在2000年2月至2018年12月期间以0.05°的空间分辨率和每月合成周期进行使用。
findingsCn: 我们的结果表明，在年降水量梯度下，生产力对滞后型降水的敏感性低于非滞后型降水。我们的结果支持这一观点，即滞后降水效应在改变生产力与降水关系中发挥着重要作用。

Example.QuestionEn: What is an example of a method used to estimate net primary productivity from remote sensing data in arid regions?
Example.QuestionCn: 在干旱地区，估计净初级生产力的一种方法是利用遥感数据。
Example.AnswerEn: An example of a method used to estimate net primary productivity from remote sensing data in arid regions is the use of the enhanced vegetation index (EVI), which is calculated from satellite data. The annual integrated EVI (iEVI) is derived and correlates highly with net primary productivity, serving as a proxy indicator.
Example.AnswerCn: 一种用于从遥感数据估计干旱地区净初级生产力的方法是使用增强植被指数（EVI），该指数是从卫星数据中计算得出的。年集成EVI（iEVI）被推导出来，并与净初级生产力高度相关，作为一个代理指标。

Definition.QuestionEn: What is the 'enhanced vegetation index (EVI)' and how is it used in estimating primary productivity?
Definition.QuestionCn:
增强植被指数（EVI）是一种用于衡量植被生长和健康状况的遥感指标。它通过分析植被反射的光谱数据，特别是在红光和近红外波段的反射，来评估植被的密度和生物量。EVI在估算初级生产力方面的应用主要体现在以下几个方面：

1. **监测植被生长**：EVI能够有效区分植被与土壤和水体的反射特征，因此在监测植被生长和变化时具有较高的准确性。

2. **评估生物量**：通过与地面实测数据的结合，EVI可以用于估算特定区域的生物量，从而间接反映初级生产力。

3. **气候变化研究**：EVI的长期监测可以帮助研究气候变化对生态系统的影响，进而影响初级生产力的变化。

4. **生态系统管理**：EVI数据可以为生态系统管理和保护提供科学依据，帮助制定可持续的土地利用和资源管理策略。
Definition.AnswerEn: The enhanced vegetation index (EVI) is a satellite-derived index that is used to estimate primary productivity by measuring vegetation greenness. In the context of the dataset, EVI data was employed to calculate the annual integrated enhanced vegetation index (iEVI), which correlates highly with net primary productivity (NPP) and can serve as a substitute indicator for NPP.
Definition.AnswerCn: 增强植被指数（EVI）是一种卫星衍生指数，用于通过测量植被的绿度来估计初级生产力。在数据集的背景下，EVI 数据被用于计算年度综合增强植被指数（iEVI），该指数与净初级生产力（NPP）高度相关，可以作为 NPP 的替代指标。

Definition.QuestionEn: What does 'remote sensing net primary productivity (NPP)' entail, and how is it calculated?
Definition.QuestionCn: “遥感净初级生产力（NPP）”涉及什么，以及如何计算？
Definition.AnswerEn: Remote sensing net primary productivity (NPP) involves estimating the amount of biomass produced by vegetation using satellite data. It is calculated from the net photosynthetic value, which is the total primary productivity minus the maintenance respiration of plants. In the dataset, NPP data was extracted from the MOD17A3HGF Version 6 product, covering the years 2001-2020.
Definition.AnswerCn: 遥感净初级生产力（NPP）涉及使用卫星数据估算植物产生的生物量。它是通过净光合值计算得出的，净光合值是总初级生产力减去植物的维持呼吸。在该数据集中，NPP数据是从MOD17A3HGF版本6产品中提取的，覆盖了2001年至2020年。

Definition.QuestionEn: What does 'lagged precipitation effect' mean in relation to ecosystem productivity?
Definition.QuestionCn: “滞后降水效应”在生态系统生产力方面的意思是什么？
Definition.AnswerEn: The 'lagged precipitation effect' refers to the impact that precipitation conditions from a previous year have on the current year's ecosystem structure and functioning. This concept is particularly relevant in dryland ecosystems, where precipitation is a limiting factor, and indicates that past climate conditions can strongly influence current productivity responses and ecosystem dynamics.
Definition.AnswerCn: “滞后降水效应”指的是前一年降水条件对当前年份生态系统结构和功能的影响。这个概念在干旱生态系统中特别相关，因为降水是一个限制性因素，表明过去的气候条件可以强烈影响当前的生产力反应和生态系统动态。

Comparison.QuestionEn: How do field-based data collection methods for measuring plant aboveground biomass in desert ecosystems compare to remote sensing techniques like the enhanced vegetation index (EVI) for estimating primary productivity?
Comparison.QuestionCn: 在沙漠生态系统中，基于实地的数据收集方法用于测量植物地上生物量与遥感技术（如增强植被指数EVI）用于估计初级生产力之间的比较。
Comparison.AnswerEn: Field-based methods involve physical sampling of vegetation during the peak growth period using sample plots, where plant species and biomass are measured directly. In contrast, remote sensing techniques like the enhanced vegetation index (EVI) estimate primary productivity using satellite data, providing a broader spatial coverage and capturing data over time. Both methods aim to quantify primary productivity but differ in scope and data acquisition techniques.
Comparison.AnswerCn: 基于实地的方法涉及在植物生长高峰期通过样本 plots 进行植物的物理采样，直接测量植物种类和生物量。相比之下，遥感技术如增强植被指数（EVI）利用卫星数据估算初级生产力，提供更广泛的空间覆盖并捕捉随时间变化的数据。这两种方法都旨在量化初级生产力，但在范围和数据获取技术上有所不同。

Comparison.QuestionEn: What are the differences in data collection challenges between measuring net primary productivity (NPP) using field sampling in desert ecosystems and utilizing MODIS remote sensing products?
Comparison.QuestionCn: 在沙漠生态系统中，使用实地采样测量净初级生产力（NPP）与利用MODIS遥感产品之间的数据收集挑战有哪些不同？
Comparison.AnswerEn: Field sampling in desert ecosystems can be challenging due to the need for precise measurements and physical accessibility to remote locations, potentially limiting data collection to specific periods. Remote sensing using MODIS products, such as the MOD17A3HGF Version 6, provides continuous and large-scale data but may face challenges like cloud cover, resolution limitations, and data accuracy in areas with low vegetation cover, which could result in data gaps or NA values.
Comparison.AnswerCn: 在沙漠生态系统中，实地采样可能面临挑战，因为需要精确的测量和对偏远地区的物理可达性，这可能限制数据收集的特定时间段。使用MODIS产品进行遥感，例如MOD17A3HGF版本6，提供连续和大规模的数据，但可能面临云层覆盖、分辨率限制和在植被覆盖稀少地区的数据准确性等挑战，这可能导致数据缺口或NA值。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: How might the choice of spatial resolution and compositing periods in vegetation indices affect the interpretation of primary productivity in dryland ecosystems?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 空间分辨率和合成周期在植被指数中的选择如何影响干旱生态系统中初级生产力的解读？
Interpretation.AnswerEn: The spatial resolution and compositing periods can influence the sensitivity and accuracy of primary productivity estimates. A finer spatial resolution may capture more detailed variations in vegetation cover, while the choice of compositing periods can affect the temporal dynamics captured by the index. The use of enhanced vegetation index (EVI) at 0.05° spatial resolution and monthly compositing periods can help in examining interannual variability and the lagged effects of precipitation on productivity, as seen in the interpretation of ecosystems' responses to precipitation variability.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 空间分辨率和合成周期可以影响初级生产力估计的敏感性和准确性。更细的空间分辨率可能捕捉到植被覆盖的更详细变化，而合成周期的选择则会影响指数所捕捉的时间动态。使用增强植被指数（EVI）在0.05°的空间分辨率和每月合成周期，可以帮助研究年际变异性和降水对生产力的滞后影响，这在解释生态系统对降水变异性的响应时得到了体现。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: What challenges could arise in using remote sensing data to estimate net primary productivity in regions with low vegetation cover?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 在植被覆盖较低的地区使用遥感数据估算净初级生产力时可能会出现哪些挑战？
Interpretation.AnswerEn: Remote sensing data, such as the MOD17A3HGF Version 6 product for net primary productivity (NPP), may encounter challenges in regions with low vegetation cover due to potential data gaps or NA values. This can complicate efforts to accurately assess productivity and necessitates robust quality control and data validation techniques to ensure reliable estimates. The presence of empty values in areas with low vegetation cover highlights the need for careful interpretation and possibly supplementary data collection methods to fill in these gaps.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 遥感数据，如MOD17A3HGF版本6产品的净初级生产力（NPP），在植被覆盖较低的地区可能会遇到挑战，因为可能存在数据缺口或NA值。这可能会使准确评估生产力变得复杂，并需要强有力的质量控制和数据验证技术，以确保可靠的估计。在植被覆盖较低的区域存在空值的情况突显了谨慎解读的必要性，并可能需要补充数据收集方法来填补这些空白。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: What factors contribute to the variability in vegetation productivity measurements when using remote sensing techniques in arid regions?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 在干旱地区使用遥感技术测量植被生产力时，导致测量变异性的因素有哪些？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: The variability in vegetation productivity measurements using remote sensing techniques in arid regions can be attributed to the low vegetation cover, which may result in null values in remote sensing net primary productivity data. Additionally, the enhanced vegetation index (EVI) and its integration (iEVI) are used as proxy indicators, and their correlation with net primary productivity may vary based on environmental conditions and data quality control percentages.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 在干旱地区，使用遥感技术测量植被生产力的变异性可以归因于低植被覆盖率，这可能导致遥感净初级生产力数据中出现空值。此外，增强植被指数（EVI）及其集成（iEVI）被用作代理指标，它们与净初级生产力的相关性可能会根据环境条件和数据质量控制百分比的不同而有所变化。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: What causes might contribute to the challenges in predicting ecosystem responses to precipitation variability in dryland areas?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 导致干旱地区生态系统对降水变化响应预测挑战的原因可能包括哪些？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: Challenges in predicting ecosystem responses to precipitation variability in dryland areas may be caused by the complex interplay of climatic, biotic, and edaphic factors, as well as the lagged effects of previous-year precipitation on current ecosystem structure and function. The legacy effects of past droughts or wet periods, which can last from less than one year to up to seven years, further complicate the prediction of ecosystem responses.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 在干旱地区，预测生态系统对降水变化的响应面临挑战，这可能是由于气候、生物和土壤因素之间复杂的相互作用，以及前一年降水对当前生态系统结构和功能的滞后影响。过去干旱或湿润时期的遗留效应，可能持续从不到一年到七年，进一步复杂化了生态系统响应的预测。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: What are the potential consequences of varying the spatial resolution of data collection on the accuracy and reliability of estimating net primary productivity in dryland ecosystems?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 改变数据收集的空间分辨率对干旱生态系统净初级生产力估计的准确性和可靠性可能产生的后果是什么？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: Varying the spatial resolution of data collection could affect the accuracy and reliability of estimating net primary productivity in dryland ecosystems by influencing the sensitivity of productivity response to precipitation, as demonstrated by the use of enhanced vegetation index (EVI) datasets at different spatial resolutions. A higher resolution may capture more detailed spatial variability in vegetation, whereas lower resolution might miss finer-scale heterogeneities.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 改变数据收集的空间分辨率可能会影响干旱生态系统净初级生产力估计的准确性和可靠性，因为这会影响生产力对降水的响应敏感性，正如在不同空间分辨率下使用增强植被指数（EVI）数据集所示。较高的分辨率可能捕捉到植被的更详细空间变异性，而较低的分辨率可能会错过更细尺度的异质性。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: How might the choice of vegetation index, such as the enhanced vegetation index (EVI), influence the interpretation of productivity-precipitation relationships in ecosystems with lagged responses?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 选择植被指数，例如增强植被指数（EVI），如何影响对具有滞后响应的生态系统中生产力-降水关系的解释？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: The choice of vegetation index, such as the enhanced vegetation index (EVI), can significantly influence the interpretation of productivity-precipitation relationships. EVI's ability to estimate primary productivity, particularly in ecosystems with lagged responses, allows for discerning lower sensitivity of productivity to precipitation and identifying interannual precipitation variability and occurrences of dry and wet years, which are critical in understanding lagged ecosystem responses.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 植被指数的选择，例如增强植被指数（EVI），可以显著影响对生产力与降水关系的解读。EVI在估计初级生产力方面的能力，特别是在具有滞后响应的生态系统中，使得能够辨别生产力对降水的较低敏感性，并识别年际降水变异性以及干湿年发生的情况，这对于理解滞后生态系统响应至关重要。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: What could be the implications of including or excluding previous-year precipitation data when modeling ecosystem productivity using datasets like those from the Tropical Rainfall Measuring Mission (TRMM)?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 在使用热带降水测量任务（TRMM）等数据集建模生态系统生产力时，包含或排除前一年降水数据可能会产生的影响是什么？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: Including previous-year precipitation data when modeling ecosystem productivity could highlight the lagged effects of past climate conditions on current ecosystem functioning, particularly in dryland ecosystems where such effects are pronounced. This approach could reveal lower sensitivity of productivity to current precipitation and provide insights into the legacy effects of precipitation variability, enhancing the understanding of ecosystem responses over time.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 在建模生态系统生产力时，纳入前一年降水数据可以突出过去气候条件对当前生态系统功能的滞后影响，特别是在干旱生态系统中，这种影响尤为明显。这种方法可以揭示生产力对当前降水的敏感性较低，并提供降水变异的遗留效应的见解，从而增强对生态系统随时间变化的响应的理解。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: Why is it important to consider the lagged effects of precipitation on plant productivity when analyzing ecosystem responses in dryland areas?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 在分析干旱地区生态系统响应时，考虑降水的滞后效应对植物生产力的重要性是什么？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: Considering the lagged effects of precipitation is important because it helps in understanding how past climatic conditions, such as previous-year precipitation, influence current ecosystem structure and functioning, particularly in drylands where precipitation is a limiting factor.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 考虑降水的滞后效应很重要，因为它有助于理解过去的气候条件，例如前一年的降水，如何影响当前生态系统的结构和功能，特别是在降水是限制因素的干旱地区。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: What motivates the use of the enhanced vegetation index (EVI) as a proxy for estimating primary productivity in ecological studies?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 增强植被指数（EVI）作为估计生态研究中初级生产力的代理指标的动机是什么？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: The use of EVI is motivated by its ability to provide a reliable proxy for primary productivity, due to its high correlation with net primary productivity, allowing researchers to estimate productivity at a large scale using remote sensing data.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: EVI的使用是因为它能够提供一个可靠的初级生产力代理，因其与净初级生产力具有很高的相关性，使研究人员能够利用遥感数据在大规模上估计生产力。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: How is the process of field sampling conducted to measure aboveground biomass in desert regions of Qinghai and Tibet, and what equipment is used during this process?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 在青海和西藏的沙漠地区，进行地面取样以测量地上生物量的过程是如何进行的，以及在此过程中使用了哪些设备。
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: Field sampling to measure aboveground biomass involves selecting a uniformly vegetated area and setting up plots of varying sizes depending on vegetation density. For denser vegetation, a 10m x 10m square plot is used, and for sparser vegetation, larger plots like 30m x 30m or 30m x 90m are used. Within these plots, smaller 1m x 1m quadrats are randomly placed for sampling. Plant samples are collected by cutting them at ground level, recording species and plant count, and drying them in a laboratory at 65°C to determine dry weight. A handheld GPS device is used to record the location, including latitude, longitude, and altitude.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 田野采样以测量地上生物量涉及选择一个均匀植被区域，并根据植被密度设置不同大小的样地。对于密集植被，使用10米 x 10米的方形样地；对于稀疏植被，使用更大的样地，如30米 x 30米或30米 x 90米。在这些样地内，随机放置小的1米 x 1米的样方进行采样。植物样本通过在地面水平切割收集，记录物种和植物数量，并在实验室中以65°C的温度干燥以确定干重。使用手持GPS设备记录位置，包括纬度、经度和海拔。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: What methodological approach is taken to integrate remote sensing data with field measurements for estimating net primary productivity in the Qinghai-Tibet Plateau?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 在青藏高原估算净初级生产力时，采用了什么方法论方法将遥感数据与实地测量相结合？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: The methodological approach involves extracting remote sensing data, specifically the Enhanced Vegetation Index (EVI) and remote sensing net primary productivity (NPP), using the latitude and longitude of 52 sample points. The EVI data from 2000-2018 is used to calculate the integrated EVI (iEVI), which is highly correlated with NPP and can serve as a surrogate for NPP. Additionally, remote sensing NPP data from the MOD17A3HGF Version 6 product is used, which accounts for net photosynthesis, calculated as gross primary productivity minus plant maintenance respiration.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 该方法论涉及提取遥感数据，特别是增强植被指数（EVI）和遥感净初级生产力（NPP），使用52个样本点的经纬度。2000-2018年的EVI数据用于计算综合EVI（iEVI），该指标与NPP高度相关，可以作为NPP的替代指标。此外，使用MOD17A3HGF版本6产品的遥感NPP数据，该数据考虑了净光合作用，计算方法为总初级生产力减去植物维持呼吸。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: What procedures are employed to handle missing values in remote sensing net primary productivity data for areas with low vegetation coverage in the Qinghai-Tibet Plateau?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 在青藏高原植被覆盖较低的地区，处理遥感净初级生产力数据缺失值所采用的程序有哪些？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: In areas with low vegetation coverage, there may be missing values (NA) in the remote sensing net primary productivity (NPP) data. While the specific procedures for handling these missing values are not detailed, common practices could include using interpolation methods, removing data points with missing values, or using statistical models to estimate missing values based on available data. These methods help ensure accurate analysis and integration with other data sources.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 在植被覆盖较低的地区，遥感净初级生产力（NPP）数据可能会存在缺失值（NA）。虽然处理这些缺失值的具体程序没有详细说明，但常见的做法包括使用插值方法、删除缺失值的数据点，或使用统计模型根据可用数据估计缺失值。这些方法有助于确保分析的准确性，并与其他数据源进行整合。

Enablement.QuestionEn: How does the integration of remote sensing data enhance the estimation of net primary productivity in desert regions?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 遥感数据的整合如何增强沙漠地区净初级生产力的估算？
Enablement.AnswerEn: The integration of remote sensing data, such as the enhanced vegetation index (EVI) and remote sensing net primary productivity (NPP) data from products like MOD17A3HGF, enhances the estimation of net primary productivity by providing spatially comprehensive and temporally consistent measurements that correlate highly with NPP. This approach allows for the extraction of productivity data across large and remote desert regions using satellite-derived indices.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 遥感数据的整合，如增强植被指数（EVI）和来自MOD17A3HGF等产品的遥感净初级生产力（NPP）数据，增强了净初级生产力的估算，因为它们提供了空间上全面和时间上连续的测量，这些测量与NPP高度相关。这种方法允许通过卫星衍生指数提取大面积偏远沙漠地区的生产力数据。

Enablement.QuestionEn: What are the challenges associated with using remote sensing data for estimating productivity in low-vegetation areas?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 使用遥感数据估算低植被区域生产力所面临的挑战有哪些？
Enablement.AnswerEn: The challenges of using remote sensing data for estimating productivity in low-vegetation areas include the potential presence of null values in remote sensing NPP data due to low vegetation coverage. This can affect the accuracy and completeness of productivity estimates, necessitating careful quality control and data processing to account for gaps or inconsistencies.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 在低植被区域使用遥感数据估算生产力的挑战包括遥感净初级生产力（NPP）数据中可能存在的空值，这通常是由于植被覆盖率低所致。这可能影响生产力估算的准确性和完整性，因此需要进行仔细的质量控制和数据处理，以应对数据中的缺口或不一致性。

Expectation.QuestionEn: Why might the enhanced vegetation index (EVI) and net primary productivity (NPP) show discrepancies in areas with low vegetation cover?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 增强植被指数（EVI）和净初级生产力（NPP）在植被覆盖较低的地区可能出现差异的原因是什么？
Expectation.AnswerEn: In areas with low vegetation cover, remote sensing data for net primary productivity might contain null values. This could cause discrepancies between EVI, which is used as a proxy for NPP, and actual NPP measurements.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 在植被覆盖较低的地区，遥感数据中的净初级生产力可能包含空值。这可能导致EVI（增强植被指数）作为净初级生产力的代理与实际净初级生产力测量之间出现差异。

Expectation.QuestionEn: Why might there be a need to use a larger or varied plot size during field sampling of vegetation biomass in desert regions?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 在沙漠地区进行植被生物量的田野采样时，可能需要使用更大或多样化的样地面积，原因是什么？
Expectation.AnswerEn: When vegetation is relatively sparse, larger plot sizes such as 30 meters by 30 meters or 30 meters by 90 meters are used to account for the distribution and variability of plant species, ensuring accurate sampling of vegetation biomass.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 当植被相对稀疏时，使用较大的样地尺寸，例如30米乘30米或30米乘90米，以考虑植物种类的分布和变异性，确保对植被生物量的准确采样。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: How would you evaluate the effectiveness of using enhanced vegetation index (EVI) as a proxy for estimating plant productivity in the context of data collection on the Qinghai-Tibet Plateau?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 如何评估在青藏高原数据收集背景下使用增强植被指数（EVI）作为估计植物生产力的代理的有效性？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: The enhanced vegetation index (EVI) is considered a reliable proxy for estimating plant productivity due to its high correlation with net primary productivity (NPP), as indicated by the calculation of integrated EVI (iEVI). This method is effective in capturing variability in plant productivity across different sample sites, especially when assessing large-scale remote sensing data such as those from the MOD13C2 and MOD17A3HGF products. However, its effectiveness may be limited in areas with low vegetation cover where remote sensing NPP might have missing values.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 增强植被指数（EVI）被认为是估计植物生产力的可靠代理，因为它与净初级生产力（NPP）具有很高的相关性，这通过集成EVI（iEVI）的计算得以体现。这种方法在捕捉不同样本地点植物生产力的变异性方面非常有效，尤其是在评估来自MOD13C2和MOD17A3HGF产品的大规模遥感数据时。然而，在植被覆盖较低的地区，其有效性可能受到限制，因为遥感NPP可能存在缺失值。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: In your opinion, what are the potential challenges in collecting field data on aboveground biomass in the Qinghai-Tibet Plateau, and how might these challenges impact the data's accuracy and reliability?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 在青藏高原收集地面数据以测量地上生物量可能面临的潜在挑战有哪些？这些挑战可能如何影响数据的准确性和可靠性？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: Collecting field data on aboveground biomass in the Qinghai-Tibet Plateau presents challenges such as the variability in vegetation cover, the harsh and remote environment, and the logistical complexities of conducting fieldwork in such areas. These factors can impact the accuracy and reliability of the data, potentially leading to underestimation or overestimation of biomass. The need to adjust plot sizes based on vegetation density and ensuring consistent sampling methods are crucial to mitigating these challenges.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 在青藏高原收集地上生物量的实地数据面临着诸多挑战，例如植被覆盖的变异性、恶劣和偏远的环境，以及在此类地区进行实地工作的后勤复杂性。这些因素可能会影响数据的准确性和可靠性，导致生物量的低估或高估。根据植被密度调整样地大小以及确保一致的采样方法对于减轻这些挑战至关重要。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: What are your thoughts on the possibility of integrating additional remote sensing datasets to improve the understanding of primary productivity in dryland ecosystems of the Qinghai-Tibet Plateau?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 我对整合额外的遥感数据集以提高对青藏高原干旱生态系统初级生产力理解的可能性有何看法？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: Integrating additional remote sensing datasets could significantly enhance the understanding of primary productivity in dryland ecosystems. By incorporating datasets that provide varied spatial and temporal resolutions, such as those from the TRMM for precipitation or other spectral indices, researchers can gain more comprehensive insights into the interactions between climatic factors and ecosystem productivity. This approach may help to overcome limitations associated with current datasets and offer a more nuanced understanding of productivity-precipitation relationships and lagged effects in these ecosystems.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 整合额外的遥感数据集可以显著增强对干旱生态系统初级生产力的理解。通过结合提供不同空间和时间分辨率的数据集，例如来自TRMM的降水数据或其他光谱指数，研究人员可以更全面地了解气候因素与生态系统生产力之间的相互作用。这种方法可能有助于克服当前数据集的局限性，并提供对生产力-降水关系及其滞后效应的更细致理解。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I don't understand how data collection methods account for variations in vegetation density during biomass sampling.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我不明白数据收集方法如何在生物量采样中考虑植被密度的变化。
Assertion.AnswerEn: Data collection methods involve setting up plots with different sizes depending on vegetation density. For dense vegetation, a 10m x 10m plot is used, while for sparse vegetation, larger plots like 30m x 30m or 30m x 90m are set up. Within these plots, smaller 1m x 1m subplots are used for detailed sampling.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 数据收集方法涉及根据植被密度设置不同大小的样地。对于密集植被，使用10米 x 10米的样地，而对于稀疏植被，则设置更大的样地，如30米 x 30米或30米 x 90米。在这些样地内，使用1米 x 1米的小样方进行详细采样。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I'm not sure how the enhanced vegetation index (EVI) is used to assess primary productivity over time.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我不确定增强植被指数（EVI）是如何用于评估时间上的初级生产力的。
Assertion.AnswerEn: The enhanced vegetation index (EVI) is used to estimate primary productivity by calculating an integrated index (iEVI) over time, which correlates highly with net primary productivity (NPP). EVI data from 2000-2018 is utilized to analyze productivity trends.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 增强植被指数（EVI）用于通过计算时间上的综合指数（iEVI）来估计初级生产力，该指数与净初级生产力（NPP）高度相关。利用2000年至2018年的EVI数据分析生产力趋势。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I can't make sense of how remote sensing data can have missing values for net primary productivity in some sampling points.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我无法理解为什么遥感数据在某些采样点的净初级生产力会有缺失值。
Assertion.AnswerEn: Remote sensing data for net primary productivity (NPP) may have missing values in areas with low vegetation cover, as these conditions can lead to gaps in data quality or coverage when using satellite-derived measurements like those from the MOD17A3HGF product.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 遥感数据的净初级生产力（NPP）在植被覆盖较低的地区可能会出现缺失值，因为这些条件可能导致使用卫星衍生测量（如MOD17A3HGF产品）时数据质量或覆盖的缺口。
